item.description:
What better way to raise awareness and funds for the Special Olympics than to get a large group of people to raise hundred of dollars each, dress up in thongs or as lobsters, then jump into the freezing winter waters of NH?

What a better photo opp than to stand off to the sides in warm clothing and take it all in with a long lens? Or put on your waders and venture out in the water a bit for a better angle. Or bring your drysuit and water gear and shoot like a boss - ambulances will be waiting nearby.

Thanks to Ken (who photographed this event in Old Orchard Beach recently) for this suggestion. Join the fun, then lunch nearby afterwards.

If you attend, please be respectful of the "penguins" and the non-plunging donors, who are the main reason and beneficiaries of this event.

More information:

Special Olympics

Seacoast Online Write-Up

Local WMUR coverage from last year

Local blogger Video from last year
item.how_to_find_us: Look for swimsuits on the beach, then look a bit farther for cameras.
item.name: 2012 Penguin Plunge
